chats.question: Create Project
chats.answer:
[github unity_2d_tutorial](https://github.com/atari-monk/unity_2d_tutorial)  
1. Install Unity Hub manager
2. Install Unity with optional Visual Studio IDE code editor (Unity Editor Version 2022.3.4f1)  
3. In Hub Create New Project Button
4. Settings: 2D, name, path
5. Scene is like a level. Kepp 2D btn on for 2d view.
6. Basic Controls:  
    1. Middle mouse button, or Hand btn on - Pan the view
    2. Mouse wheel - zoom
    3. Use Icons (hand, arrows, circle ...) or keys qwerty
    4. Views are dragable and customizable, Top right, layout menu, set default

chats.question: Tilemap
chats.answer:
1. Window -> Asset Store -> Search Online
2. Type 0 $ in filter, find Pixel Adventure 1 in search, Open in Unity
3. In package manager, download, import, keep all selected, import
4. Now files are displayed in unity, go to assets clict show in explorer to see files in file system
5. Select Terrain tiles and set Pixels Per Unit to 16, Sprite Mode to multiple, Sprite editor button, apply  
6. In maximized editor, Slice, Grid by cell size, set 16x16, Slice, Applay (top right), close sprite editor  
7. In hierarchy, add 2d object, tilemap, rectangular, rename to Terrain  
8. Window -> 2d -> Tile Palete; create new palete, Create, select Asset folder
9. Go to Assets find Terrain and drag png on Terrain Palete, create folder Tiles, select it to save tiles there
10. you can now use tiles from Tile Palette to draw on scene
11. Use tools in Tile Pallete (they have icons and keys) to select, move, draw rectangle with selected tiles
12. Now again prepare tilemap for background, set 16 per unit, multiple, add new tilemap  
13. Now click Sorting Layer, create 2 layers, put them in order of rendering and assign tilemaps to them
14. Create a object in root of scene hierarchy, 2d obj, sprite, rectangular, F2 player, F to focus, W to move it
15. Go to character sprites, select all, 16 per unit, applay, select idle, select first frame, drop it on players sprite field
16. Add Rigidbody 2D component to player  
17. Add Boxcollider 2D component to player
18. Add Tilemap Collider 2D component to Terrain
19. You can hide Terrain with eye icon  
20. Put Tile Palette tab on right panel so scene is bigger
21. Add Composite Collider 2D for Terrain, check box Used by Composite in Tilemap Collider 2D, select static Body Type in Rigidbody 2D  
22. Question mark in circle means link to online docs, component have it
23. Box near component name is used to check.uncheck renderer, to see collision boundry or whatever
24. Add script component to player, name it PlayerMovement
25. Edit -> Preferances -> External Script Editor, I have Open by file extension for some reason
26. Double click on script to open in ide editor
